[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/backup_types/state_snapshot/manifest.rs] [Struct: StateSnapshotChunk] [Integer Overflow] Can an attacker craft a malicious StateSnapshotChunk with first_idx > last_idx causing integer underflow when calculating chunk size (last_idx - first_idx + 1), potentially bypassing size limits or causing panics during validation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/backup_types/state_snapshot/manifest.rs] [Struct: StateSnapshotChunk] [Integer Overflow] Can first_idx or last_idx be set to usize::MAX causing arithmetic overflow when incrementing indices during chunk processing, potentially skipping validation logic or corrupting state indices? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/backup_types/state_snapshot/manifest.rs] [Struct: StateSnapshotChunk] [Range Inconsistency] If first_key and last_key hash values are reversed or mismatched with first_idx/last_idx ordering, can this cause incorrect state reconstruction where accounts are restored to wrong positions in the Merkle tree? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/backup_types/state_snapshot/manifest.rs] [Struct: StateSnapshotChunk] [Hash Collision] Can an attacker deliberately generate StateSnapshotChunks with colliding first_key or last_key HashValues to overlap multiple chunks at the same key range, potentially causing duplicate state entries or state corruption during restore? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/backup_types/state_snapshot/manifest.rs] [Struct: StateSnapshotChunk] [Proof Bypass] If the proof FileHandle points to an empty file or invalid BCS data, can deserialization succeed but proof verification be skipped, allowing unverified state data to be restored to AptosDB? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/backup_types/state_snapshot/manifest.rs] [Struct: StateSnapshotChunk] [File Handle Manipulation] Can an attacker provide a blobs FileHandle pointing to a file containing more records than indicated by last_idx - first_idx + 1, causing excess state values to be silently included without proof verification? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/backup_types/state_snapshot/manifest.rs] [Struct: StateSnapshotChunk] [File Handle Manipulation] If the blobs FileHandle references a maliciously large file (e.g., petabytes), can this cause memory exhaustion during deserialization before size validation occurs? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/backup_types/state_snapshot/manifest.rs] [Struct: StateSnapshotChunk] [Deserialization Attack] Can a malformed BCS-serialized (StateKey, StateValue) tuple in the blobs file cause arbitrary code execution or memory corruption during bcs::from_bytes deserialization? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/backup_types/state_snapshot/manifest.rs] [Struct: StateSnapshotChunk] [Index Wraparound] If first_idx is close to usize::MAX and chunks overlap, can index arithmetic cause wraparound leading to chunks being processed out of order or skipped entirely? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/backup_types/state_snapshot/manifest.rs] [Struct: StateSnapshotChunk] [Proof Substitution] Can an attacker substitute the SparseMerkleRangeProof in the proof FileHandle with a valid proof for different state data, passing verification but restoring incorrect account states? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/backup_types/state_snapshot/manifest.rs] [Struct: StateSnapshotBackup] [Version Manipulation] Can an attacker create a StateSnapshotBackup with version set to a future version number that hasn't occurred yet, potentially causing validators to accept invalid state snapshots as legitimate? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/backup_types/state_snapshot/manifest.rs] [Struct: StateSnapshotBackup] [Epoch Mismatch] If the epoch field doesn't match the epoch in the LedgerInfoWithSignatures proof, can this cause validators to restore state using wrong validator set for signature verification, bypassing BFT consensus guarantees? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/backup_types/state_snapshot/manifest.rs] [Struct: StateSnapshotBackup] [Root Hash Forgery] Can an attacker craft a StateSnapshotBackup where root_hash doesn't match the actual state root but still passes verification due to missing validation between manifest root_hash and proof root_hash? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/backup_types/state_snapshot/manifest.rs] [Struct: StateSnapshotBackup] [Chunk Gap Attack] Can the chunks Vec contain gaps in the index ranges (e.g., chunk1: 0-99, chunk2: 200-299) causing accounts 100-199 to be missing from restored state without detection? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/backup_types/state_snapshot/manifest.rs] [Struct: StateSnapshotBackup] [Chunk Overlap Attack] Can chunks have overlapping index ranges (e.g., chunk1: 0-100, chunk2: 50-150) causing the same account indices to be restored multiple times with potentially conflicting state values? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/backup_types/state_snapshot/manifest.rs] [Struct: StateSnapshotBackup] [Chunk Ordering] If chunks are not sorted by first_idx/first_key, can out-of-order processing cause Jellyfish Merkle tree construction to fail or produce incorrect root hash during restoration? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/backup_types/state_snapshot/manifest.rs] [Struct: StateSnapshotBackup] [Empty Chunks Vector] Can a StateSnapshotBackup with an empty chunks Vec still pass validation and be accepted, potentially restoring an empty state tree that erases all account data? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/backup_types/state_snapshot/manifest.rs] [Struct: StateSnapshotBackup] [Duplicate Chunks] Can the chunks Vec contain duplicate StateSnapshotChunk entries with identical index ranges, causing the same state data to be processed multiple times and potentially corrupting leaf counts in the Merkle tree? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/backup_types/state_snapshot/manifest.rs] [Struct: StateSnapshotBackup] [Proof File Size] If the proof FileHandle points to an extremely large BCS file (gigabytes), can this cause memory exhaustion when deserializing TransactionInfoWithProof and LedgerInfoWithSignatures before size limits are checked? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/backup_types/state_snapshot/manifest.rs] [Struct: StateSnapshotBackup] [Version Rollback] Can an attacker provide a StateSnapshotBackup with an old version number to rollback validator state to a previous epoch, potentially reverting staking changes or governance decisions? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/backup_types/state_snapshot/manifest.rs] [Derive: Deserialize] [Serde Bomb] Can a deeply nested JSON structure in the StateSnapshotBackup manifest cause stack overflow during serde_json deserialization, crashing the restore process? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/backup_types/state_snapshot/manifest.rs] [Derive: Deserialize] [Resource Exhaustion] Can a malicious manifest with millions of StateSnapshotChunk entries cause heap exhaustion when deserializing the chunks Vec before any size validation occurs? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/backup_types/state_snapshot/manifest.rs] [Derive: Deserialize] [Unicode Exploit] Can malformed UTF-8 sequences in FileHandle paths within the JSON manifest trigger undefined behavior or crashes during deserialization? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/backup_types/state_snapshot/manifest.rs] [Derive: Deserialize] [Integer Parsing] Can version or epoch fields containing extremely large integers (beyond u64::MAX as JSON number) cause integer overflow or panic during JSON to Rust type conversion? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/backup_types/state_snapshot/manifest.rs] [Derive: Deserialize] [Type Confusion] Can mismatched JSON types (e.g., string instead of number for version field) be exploited to bypass type validation and inject unexpected values into StateSnapshotBackup?
